package-manager.name: depot
package-manager.title: OpenSSL SSL/TLS Crypto Toolkit
package-manager.description: The OpenSSL Project is a collaborative effort to develop a robust, commercial-grade, full-featured, and Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) protocols with full-strength cryptography world-wide.

item.para: Apply patch for CVE-2012-0884 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-0884). The implementation of Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) and PKCS #7 does not properly restrict certain oracle behavior, which makes it easier for context-dependent attackers to decrypt data via a Million Message Attack (MMA) adaptive chosen ciphertext attack. NOTE: additional patch to detect symmetric crypto errors in PKCS7_decrypt and initialise tkeylen properly.

Apply patch for CVE-2012-1165 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-1165). The mime_param_cmp function in crypto/asn1/asn_mime.c allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a crafted S/MIME message, a different vulnerability than CVE-2006-7250.

Apply patch for CVE-2012-2110 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-2110). The asn1_d2i_read_bio function in crypto/asn1/a_d2i_fp.c does not properly interpret integer data, which allows remote attackers to conduct buffer overflow attacks, and cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact, via crafted DER data, as demonstrated by an X.509 certificate or an RSA public key.

Apply patch for CVE-2012-2333 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-2333). Integer underflow when TLS 1.1, TLS 1.2, or DTLS is used with CBC encryption, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted TLS packet that is not properly handled during a certain explicit IV calculation.

Apply patch for CVE-2012-0027 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-0027). The GOST ENGINE in OpenSSL does not properly handle invalid parameters for the GOST block cipher, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via crafted data from a TLS client.

Apply patch for CVE-2012-0050 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-0050). OpenSSL does not properly support DTLS applications, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via unspecified vectors. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2011-4108.

Apply patch for CVE-2011-4108 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-4108). The DTLS implementation in OpenSSL performs a MAC check only if certain padding is valid, which makes it easier for remote attackers to recover plaintext via a padding oracle attack.

Apply patch for CVE-2011-4576 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-4576). The SSL 3.0 implementation in OpenSSL does not properly initialize data structures for block cipher padding, which might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information by decrypting the padding data sent by an SSL peer.

Apply patch for CVE-2011-4577 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-4577). OpenSSL, when RFC 3779 support is enabled, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure) via an X.509 certificate containing certificate-extension data associated with (1) IP address blocks or (2) Autonomous System (AS) identifiers.

Apply patch for CVE-2011-4619 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-4619). The Server Gated Cryptography (SGC) implementation in OpenSSL does not properly handle handshake restarts, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via unspecified vectors.
